description: The trend dashboard displaying reports containing the 5 most/least utilized virtual machines by memory/CPU, over a selected period

panels.content: ###### This dashboard displays usage rates for the 5 most and least utilized virtual machines and hosts by memory and by CPU in the selected cluster over a selected period.

panels.description: This report displays weighted average daily peak memory usage for the top five busiest hosts of a selected cluster and over a selected period.

targets.rawSql:
-- BR4B - This report returns the
-- cpu and memory usage over time
-- for the 5 most utilized hosts.

-- This query (A) displays recent data from the last hours, 
-- and for each minute, using the samples table.

-- Memory usage
SELECT DISTINCT
    $__time(sub_query.time),
    COALESCE ( host_name, MAX ( host_name ) over ( partition BY 1 ), '' ) AS host_name,
    MEM_Usage
FROM 
    (
        SELECT
            samples.host_id,
            CASE
                WHEN delete_date IS NULL
                    THEN host_name
                ELSE host_name || ' (Removed on ' || CAST ( CAST ( delete_date AS date ) AS varchar ) || ')'
            END AS host_name,
            samples.history_datetime AS time,
            SUM ( COALESCE ( samples.max_memory_usage, 0 ) * COALESCE ( samples.minutes_in_status, 0 ) ) /
            SUM ( COALESCE ( samples.minutes_in_status, 0 ) ) AS MEM_Usage
        FROM
            (
                SELECT history_datetime, host_id, memory_usage_percent AS max_memory_usage, minutes_in_status
                FROM v4_4_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_samples
            ) AS samples
            INNER JOIN v4_4_configuration_history_hosts
                ON 
                    (
                    v4_4_configuration_history_hosts.host_id =
                    samples.host_id
                    )   
        WHERE
            samples.history_datetime >= $__timeFrom()
            AND samples.history_datetime < $__timeTo()
            -- Here we get the latest hosts configuration
            AND v4_4_configuration_history_hosts.history_id 
                IN 
                    (
                        SELECT MAX ( a.history_id )
                        FROM v4_4_configuration_history_hosts a
                        GROUP BY a.host_id
                    )
            AND samples.host_id 
                IN 
                    (
                        -- Calculation of top 5 hosts
                        SELECT a.host_id
                        FROM
                            (
                                SELECT history_datetime, host_id, host_status, memory_usage_percent AS max_memory_usage, minutes_in_status 
                                FROM v4_4_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_samples
                            ) AS a
                            INNER JOIN v4_4_configuration_history_hosts b
                                ON 
                                    ( 
                                        a.host_id = 
                                        b.host_id 
                                    )
                        WHERE
                            -- Here we filter by active hosts only
                            a.host_status = 1
                            -- Here we filter by the datacenter chosen by the user
                            AND b.cluster_id 
                                IN 
                                    (
                                        SELECT v4_4_configuration_history_clusters.cluster_id
                                        FROM v4_4_configuration_history_clusters
                                        WHERE v4_4_configuration_history_clusters.datacenter_id IN ($datacenter_id)
                                    )
                            -- Here we filter by the clusters chosen by the user
                            AND b.cluster_id IN ($cluster_id)
                            AND a.history_datetime >= $__timeFrom()
                            AND a.history_datetime < $__timeTo()
                            -- Here we get the latest hosts configuration
                            AND b.history_id 
                                IN 
                                    (
                                        SELECT MAX ( g.history_id )
                                        FROM v4_4_configuration_history_hosts g
                                        GROUP BY g.host_id
                                    )
                            -- Here we get or remove deleted entities according to what the user chose
                            -- in the "show_deleted" parameter.
                            AND
                                CASE
                                    WHEN '$show_deleted'='Yes'
                                        THEN 1=1
                                    WHEN '$show_deleted'='No'
                                        THEN delete_date isnull
                                END
                        GROUP BY a.host_id
                        -- The hosts will be ordered according to the summery of
                        -- memory usage percent. This defines the busiest hosts.
                        ORDER BY
                                SUM ( COALESCE ( a.max_memory_usage * a.minutes_in_status, 0 ) ) /
                                SUM ( COALESCE ( a.minutes_in_status, 0 ) ) 
                                -- Here we order by most utillized hosts
                                DESC
                        LIMIT 5
                    )
        GROUP BY samples.host_id, host_name, delete_date, history_datetime
    ) AS sub_query
-- Show data only when the selected period is up to 24 hours back 
WHERE $__timeFrom() >= (NOW() - INTERVAL '1443 MINUTES')
ORDER BY sub_query.time

-- BR4B - This report returns the
-- cpu and memory usage over time
-- for the 5 most utilized hosts.

-- This query (B) displays historical and recent data 
-- excluding the last few hours, by using the hourly and daily tables.

-- Memory usage
SELECT DISTINCT
    $__time(sub_query.time),
    COALESCE ( host_name, MAX ( host_name ) over ( partition BY 1 ), '' ) AS host_name,
    MEM_Usage
FROM 
    (
        SELECT
            hourly_daily.host_id,
            CASE
                WHEN delete_date IS NULL
                    THEN host_name
                ELSE host_name || ' (Removed on ' || CAST ( CAST ( delete_date AS date ) AS varchar ) || ')'
            END AS host_name,
            hourly_daily.history_datetime AS time,
            SUM ( COALESCE ( hourly_daily.max_memory_usage, 0 ) * COALESCE ( hourly_daily.minutes_in_status, 0 ) ) /
            SUM ( COALESCE ( hourly_daily.minutes_in_status, 0 ) ) AS MEM_Usage
        FROM
            (
                    SELECT history_datetime, host_id, max_memory_usage, minutes_in_status
                    FROM v4_4_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_hourly
                UNION
                    SELECT history_datetime, host_id, max_memory_usage, minutes_in_status
                    FROM v4_4_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_daily
                    WHERE
                        history_datetime <
                            (
                                SELECT MIN ( history_datetime )
                                FROM v4_4_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_hourly
                            )
            ) AS hourly_daily
            INNER JOIN v4_4_configuration_history_hosts
                ON 
                    (
                    v4_4_configuration_history_hosts.host_id =
                    hourly_daily.host_id
                    )   
        WHERE
            hourly_daily.history_datetime >= $__timeFrom()
            AND hourly_daily.history_datetime < $__timeTo()
            -- Here we get the latest hosts configuration
            AND v4_4_configuration_history_hosts.history_id 
                IN 
                    (
                        SELECT MAX ( a.history_id )
                        FROM v4_4_configuration_history_hosts a
                        GROUP BY a.host_id
                    )
            AND hourly_daily.host_id 
                IN 
                    (
                        -- Calculation of top 5 hosts
                        SELECT a.host_id
                        FROM
                            (
                                    SELECT history_datetime, host_id, host_status, max_memory_usage, minutes_in_status
                                    FROM v4_4_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_hourly
                                UNION
                                    SELECT history_datetime, host_id, host_status, max_memory_usage, minutes_in_status 
                                    FROM v4_4_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_daily
                                    WHERE
                                        history_datetime <
                                            (
                                                SELECT MIN ( history_datetime )
                                                FROM v4_4_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_hourly
                                            )
                            ) AS a
                            INNER JOIN v4_4_configuration_history_hosts b
                                ON 
                                    ( 
                                        a.host_id = 
                                        b.host_id 
                                    )
                        WHERE
                            -- Here we filter by active hosts only
                            a.host_status = 1
                            -- Here we filter by the datacenter chosen by the user
                            AND b.cluster_id 
                                IN 
                                    (
                                        SELECT v4_4_configuration_history_clusters.cluster_id
                                        FROM v4_4_configuration_history_clusters
                                        WHERE v4_4_configuration_history_clusters.datacenter_id IN ($datacenter_id)
                                    )
                            -- Here we filter by the clusters chosen by the user
                            AND b.cluster_id IN ($cluster_id)
                            AND a.history_datetime >= $__timeFrom()
                            AND a.history_datetime < $__timeTo()
                            -- Here we get the latest hosts configuration
                            AND b.history_id 
                                IN 
                                    (
                                        SELECT MAX ( g.history_id )
                                        FROM v4_4_configuration_history_hosts g
                                        GROUP BY g.host_id
                                    )
                            -- Here we get or remove deleted entities according to what the user chose
                            -- in the "show_deleted" parameter.
                            AND
                                CASE
                                    WHEN '$show_deleted'='Yes'
                                        THEN 1=1
                                    WHEN '$show_deleted'='No'
                                        THEN delete_date isnull
                                END
                        GROUP BY a.host_id
                        -- The hosts will be ordered according to the summery of
                        -- memory usage percent. This defines the busiest hosts.
                        ORDER BY
                                SUM ( COALESCE ( a.max_memory_usage * a.minutes_in_status, 0 ) ) /
                                SUM ( COALESCE ( a.minutes_in_status, 0 ) ) 
                                -- Here we order by most utillized hosts
                                DESC
                        LIMIT 5
                    )
        GROUP BY hourly_daily.host_id, host_name, delete_date, history_datetime
    ) AS sub_query
-- Show data only when the selected period is up to 24 hours back 
WHERE $__timeFrom() < (NOW() - INTERVAL '1443 MINUTES')
ORDER BY sub_query.time

panels.title: Five Least Utilized Virtual Machines by CPU (over time) (BR12)

list.definition:
SELECT DISTINCT   
    CAST ( datacenter_id AS varchar ) AS __value,  
    CASE          
        WHEN delete_date IS NULL  	     	    
            THEN datacenter_name 	 	
        WHEN delete_date IS NOT null  	      	    
            THEN datacenter_name || ' (Removed on ' || CAST ( CAST ( delete_date AS date ) AS varchar ) || ')'  
    END AS __text  		
FROM v4_4_configuration_history_datacenters  		
WHERE       		    
    history_id           			    
        IN               				
            (  	             					
                SELECT MAX ( a.history_id )  		         					
                FROM v4_4_configuration_history_datacenters a  		         					
                GROUP BY a.datacenter_id 	         				
            ) 	 		
    AND datacenter_id  	         			    
        IN 			     				    
            ( 					 						
                SELECT DISTINCT datacenter_id 					 						
                FROM v4_4_configuration_history_clusters 					 						
                WHERE  					     						    
                    cluster_id 					         						        
                        IN 					             						            
                            ( 									 										
                                SELECT DISTINCT cluster_id 									 										
                                FROM v4_4_configuration_history_vms  								 									
                            ) 						    
                    OR cluster_id  						        
                        IN 						            
                            ( 										
                                SELECT DISTINCT cluster_id 										
                                FROM v4_4_configuration_history_hosts 									
                            ) 					
            ) 	 			
    AND 	    			    
        CASE  	        				    
            WHEN '$show_deleted'='Yes' 	            					   
                THEN 1=1 		    					
            WHEN '$show_deleted'='No' 		        					    
                THEN v4_4_configuration_history_datacenters.delete_date ISNULL 	                
        END

                )  			
    ) 		
    AND 	    		    
        CASE  	        			    
            WHEN '$show_deleted'='Yes' 	            				    
                THEN 1=1 		    				
            WHEN '$show_deleted'='No' 		        				    
                THEN v4_4_configuration_history_clusters.delete_date ISNULL 	    			
        END     		
    AND datacenter_id IN ($datacenter_id)
